msContents.summary: A receipt of an unspecified amount of money, which will be later repaid in the form of four artabas of vegetable seed.

msItemStruct.note: Printed plate: Hoogendijk - van Minnen, plate XX
Translation: P. L. Bat 25 25 (see below, English)
The papyrus exists of four fragments. Fragment 1 and 2 were set as inv. 6, fragment 3 and 4 as inv. 176. Willy Clarysse put them together in November 1980.

condition.ab: The papyrus is broken on the upper, right and lower part. Leiden. Pap. Inst. inv. 6 fits on the left of Leiden Pap. Inst. inv. 176.

layout.ab: On the verso two lines along the fibers, but upside down compared to each other and ca. 5 cm apart.

handDesc.p: There are four different hands. The first hand is line 1-4, the second 5-12, the third 12-14, the fourth 14-15.

listBibl.bibl: F.A.J. Hoogendijk - P. van Minnen, Papyri, Ostraca, Parchments and Waxed Tablets in the Leiden Papyrological Institute (P. L. Bat. 25) (Papyrologica Lugduno-Batava 25, Leiden 1991), p. 128-131 P.Leid.Inst. 25 is also cited as P. L. Bat 25 25
